snippet: Advisers and allies say Mrs. Clinton would try to find common ground with Republicans on immigration and infrastructure spending, and appoint women to half of her cabinet posts....
abstract: Hillary Clinton's plans for her first 100 days in office, should she be elected president, include quickly finding ground with Republican lawmakers, placing women in key positions of power and bringing back intimate negotiation style; it remains to be seen whether Republicans would be willing to negotiate, while some liberals have called for more aggressive pushback against Republican agenda.
lead_paragraph: Advisers and allies say Mrs. Clinton would try to find common ground with Republicans on immigration and infrastructure spending, and appoint women to half of her cabinet posts.

headline.main: ‘President Hillary Clinton?’ She Wants Progress on Immigration and to Drink With G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: A Second President Clinton?  Mapping Out Her First 100 Days
